intro: Gongrothamnus solidaginifolius, commonly known as the goldenleaf gorse, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is adapted to grow in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant features wiry, evergreen stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, needle-like, and often covered in fine, white hairs. It plays an important ecological role by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
